Bug.Summery: Disassembler doesn't show actual modifiers for member types
Bug.WithStack: Using RC1, when the member type is private or static, the disassembler doesn't show it in the modifiers output. We need to check if the class is an inner class and gets its modifiers from the inner info attribute. Fixed and released in 2.1 stream. Verified on the JDT/core side, but the UI should create a ClassFileReader with this flag on IClassFileReader.CLASSFILE_ATTRIBUTES in order to see the "actual" modifiers. If the inner info is not read, then the actual modifier is unknown. Verified. Open bug 34373 against JDT/UI.
Bug.WithOutStack: Using RC1, when the member type is private or static, the disassembler doesn't show it in the modifiers output. We need to check if the class is an inner class and gets its modifiers from the inner info attribute. Fixed and released in 2.1 stream. Verified on the JDT/core side, but the UI should create a ClassFileReader with this flag on IClassFileReader.CLASSFILE_ATTRIBUTES in order to see the "actual" modifiers. If the inner info is not read, then the actual modifier is unknown. Verified. Open bug 34373 against JDT/UI.

Bug.Summery: Allow text-selection for code assist to span more than one line
Bug.WithStack:
The current code-assist allows a single word to be selected and then a psuedo-macro run to insert some behaviour (such as 'print out variable') using the 'selected_word' variable in Preferences -> Java -> Editor -> Templates
"Print out expression"
System.out.println("${selected_word}");
However, this fails if the selection consists of more than one line.
Instead, it would be advantageous to allow multiple-line selects to take place which would allow templates such as
"Generate if"
if (${test}${cursor}) { ${selected_text} }
Whist this works for single-line values, it doesn't work for multi-line values. If the selected_word was replaced with selected_text then it would be possible to provide features otherwise described by bug 32082 I think you mean "more than one line" in the summary don't you? Thanks. Changed sentence in my head whilst in the middle of writing it ... Quick assist (ctrl-1) gives you an approximation of this capability today. If you select some text, you can then type ctrl-1 to surround with your choice of do, for, if, try, while. John, what version is that? I'm using 2.1RC1 and I don't have that in the quick-assist menu; just a bunch of classes/fields/methods (usually the publicly available static ones)
I've created the template (shown in #1) in 2.1RC1, and it works provided that the selected text doesn't contain a newline; if it does, the template doesn't seem to show up at all. I guess you work with a workspace you created with an older version than RC1. In this case you have to press the "Restore Defaults" button on the Templates' preference page. We added new templates that make use of the newly introduced content assist variables $word_selection and $line_selection. Those templates that make use of the $line_selection variable are proposed by quick assist in case of a multi-line selection. Yes, this closes the suggestion that I had here. I do have an issue that the line_selection now no longer shows up /unless/ you have multiple lines, which requires that anything using a single line now can't be captured.
The solution, though ugly, is to have two templates for the 'if' generation; one showing for a word_selection and the other for a line_selection.
I'll close this bug and open a new bug for this new issue. See bug 33012

However, this fails if the selection consists of more than one line.

If the selected_word was replaced with selected_text then it would be possible to provide features otherwise described by bug 32082 I think you mean "more than one line" in the summary don't you? If you select some text, you can then type ctrl-1 to surround with your choice of do, for, if, try, while. John, what version is that? We added new templates that make use of the newly introduced content assist variables $word_selection and $line_selection. I'll close this bug and open a new bug for this new issue. See bug 33012

Bug.Summery: Java preferences don't always remember history
Bug.WithStack:
build RC1, win2k, ibm jre 1.3.1 sr2
When changing some of the Java preferences, some of them remember your history (when you go back into the Preferences dialog) and some don't.
For instance when you turn on "show line numbers" and then go back into the preferences dialog, the selection tree is collapsed. But if you turn off "show line numbers" and then go back in, the current selection is Java -> Editor. Remembering the last preference node is done by Platform/UI.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 33085 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
build RC1, win2k, ibm jre 1.3.1 sr2
When changing some of the Java preferences, some of them remember your history (when you go back into the Preferences dialog) and some don't.
For instance when you turn on "show line numbers" and then go back into the preferences dialog, the selection tree is collapsed. But if you turn off "show line numbers" and then go back in, the current selection is Java -> Editor. Remembering the last preference node is done by Platform/UI.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 33085 ***

Bug.Summery: Caught/Uncaught exception broken on OSX
Bug.WithStack:
throw some uncaught exception in a method. Create an exception breakpoint for for that exception and mark it caught only. Debug. Debugger still stops on the exception. The inverse situation works: catch the exception and set the breakpoint to be uncaught only. Do you a the preference to suspend on uncaught exceptions on? test case: Write code that throws an exception. Make sure exception is not caught anywhere. Create an exception breakpoint for the exception being thrown. Mark it as 'Caught' but NOT 'Uncaught'. Debug. Debugger stops on exception before stack trace is printed to console. This works on WinXP. Are you running a 1.3.1 or a 1.4.1 VM?
1.3.1. My understanding was we can't get a hold of a 1.4.1 VM for OSX for legal reasons. I can no longer duplicate. I think I must have had the 'Suspend on uncaught exception' pref turned on. Closing as INVALID.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.cvs.ssh 1 0 Feb 24, 2003 15:45:34.250 !MESSAGE Added host key for dev.eclipse.org to known_hosts.
Would either expect no .log entry or a marker if it is thought as an information for the user. *** Bug 32711 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This is information and for 2.1 will remain in the log but we will expand the information message to be more precise. Bug.Summery: Repeated error message

Lines.Line: 1) Create a simple project
2) Add a file foo.doc
3) Edit the file externally using Word
4) Try to delete the project.

Bug.WithStack:
Build: 2.1 RC1
1) Create a simple project 2) Add a file foo.doc 3) Edit the file externally using Word 4) Try to delete the project.
Deletion fails because foo.doc is in use. This is expected. However, the details area of the error dialog repeats the message:
Could not delete: d:\eclipse\test\Foo\foo.doc Could not delete: d:\eclipse\test\Foo\foo.doc John, Foo is a folder name or a project name?
I can reproduce this error, but only the offending file is inside a folder (the number of messages I get corresponds to the file depth inside the project). I meant: ...only *when* the offending file... Strange, from the error message, it looks like it's just in a project. However, I can't reproduce this now. Just like you, I can only reproduce the problem when the file is inside a folder. In the the easily reproducible case, the reason is that the DeleteVisitor is relying on FileSystemResourceManager#delete(File, MultiStatus) to delete files and directories. That method performs a best-effort deletion in the file system, reporting any problems deleting files and directories. But the DeleteVisitor also performs a best-effort deletion, and it is calling FileSystemStore#delete(File, MultiStatus) for the offending file and then for its parent, and the parent of its parent, and so on, appending the same error message for each level (we should be calling #delete(File) instead and reporting the exceptions in the DeleteVisitor).
Also, in the ResourceTree class, when a failure occurs while deleting folders, two status objects are being added (it should return after adding a status object reporting the error, since there is nothing else to do later). Created attachment 3830 patch for core.resources
Fixes the two problems described in comment 4. (contains also fix for bug 33772) Released. Verified in RC3
Bug.WithOutStack:
Build: 2.1 RC1
1) Create a simple project 2) Add a file foo.doc 3) Edit the file externally using Word 4) Try to delete the project.
Deletion fails because foo.doc is in use. This is expected. However, the details area of the error dialog repeats the message:
Could not delete: d:\eclipse\test\Foo\foo.doc Could not delete: d:\eclipse\test\Foo\foo.doc John, Foo is a folder name or a project name?
I can reproduce this error, but only the offending file is inside a folder (the number of messages I get corresponds to the file depth inside the project). I meant: ...only *when* the offending file... Strange, from the error message, it looks like it's just in a project. However, I can't reproduce this now. Just like you, I can only reproduce the problem when the file is inside a folder. In the the easily reproducible case, the reason is that the DeleteVisitor is relying on FileSystemResourceManager#delete(File, MultiStatus) to delete files and directories. That method performs a best-effort deletion in the file system, reporting any problems deleting files and directories. But the DeleteVisitor also performs a best-effort deletion, and it is calling FileSystemStore#delete(File, MultiStatus) for the offending file and then for its parent, and the parent of its parent, and so on, appending the same error message for each level (we should be calling #delete(File) instead and reporting the exceptions in the DeleteVisitor).
Also, in the ResourceTree class, when a failure occurs while deleting folders, two status objects are being added (it should return after adding a status object reporting the error, since there is nothing else to do later). Created attachment 3830 patch for core.resources
Fixes the two problems described in comment 4. (contains also fix for bug 33772) Released. Verified in RC3

Bug.Summery: Basic UI: Contents does not reveal open book.
Bug.WithStack: 2.1 RC1. Netscape 4 browser. When one of the last books is selected in the contents, the book loads, and is shown after the closed books. If window size is small, the expanded book is not visible, because view did not automatically scrolled to reveal it. To the user it looks like the frame reloaded and nothing changed. Basic UI is provide reasonable usability for older browsers. We will not provide all features.
Bug.WithOutStack: 2.1 RC1. Netscape 4 browser. When one of the last books is selected in the contents, the book loads, and is shown after the closed books. If window size is small, the expanded book is not visible, because view did not automatically scrolled to reveal it. To the user it looks like the frame reloaded and nothing changed. Basic UI is provide reasonable usability for older browsers. We will not provide all features.

Bug.Summery: Accessibility; focus does not traverse around in F1 infopop
Bug.WithStack: Pressing tab multiple times, results in focus following all links, and then getting lost. It does not come back to the first link. It is required to use Sthift-tab to get the focus back to the last link. Shift-tab works O.K., i.e. when focus is on the first link, pressing the combination (twice) will bring the focus to the last link. Same problem on Solaris And Linux motif. The doit field of an traverse event is false when delivered to shell's traverse listener. This is only the case when "Tab" is pressed. When "Shift-Tab" is used the doit is true. We do not change the doit, and the event gets canceled. These are SWT bugs. The traverse listener should not be called at all when tab is pressed. I have released a workaround in help to set doit to true. I have opened bug 33776, bug 33777, bug 33778 agains SWT regarding tab key and focus issues. The SWT bug 33776 has been fixed. I have tested today's nightly build, and it appears the the workaround is no longer needed. I will remove it from our code.
Bug.WithOutStack: Pressing tab multiple times, results in focus following all links, and then getting lost. It does not come back to the first link. It is required to use Sthift-tab to get the focus back to the last link. Shift-tab works O.K., i.e. when focus is on the first link, pressing the combination (twice) will bring the focus to the last link. Same problem on Solaris And Linux motif. The doit field of an traverse event is false when delivered to shell's traverse listener. This is only the case when "Tab" is pressed. When "Shift-Tab" is used the doit is true. We do not change the doit, and the event gets canceled. These are SWT bugs. The traverse listener should not be called at all when tab is pressed. I have released a workaround in help to set doit to true. I have opened bug 33776, bug 33777, bug 33778 agains SWT regarding tab key and focus issues. The SWT bug 33776 has been fixed. I have tested today's nightly build, and it appears the the workaround is no longer needed. I will remove it from our code.

Bug.WithStack:
Build: RC1 and 20030224 JDK: Sun JDK 1.4.1
Reproduce: 1. Create a new Java project, and a main class that uses a non-JRE library such as SWT: import org.eclipse.swt.SWT; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println(SWT.getPlatform()); } }
2. In the Project's "Java Build Path" (right-click on it and click Properties), under the "Libraries" tab, click on "Add Variable..."
3. Select "ECLIPSE_HOME", click "Extend...", and navigate to swt.jar.
4. Click OK, OK, and run the main class as a Java Application. I get the following: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/SWT at Main.main(Main.java:4) Exception in thread "main"
Now remove swt.jar from the classpath, and add it as an "External Jar" instead of an extension to the variable, and rerun the App. It should work this time.
In the launch configurations, everything looks good, but when the launch is done using the variable, swt.jar is missing from the "-classpath" option on the command-line.

Bug.Summery: Ant task hyperlink for tasks
Bug.WithStack: The hyperlink for Ant tasks differs from the selection that you get from the Ant Editor outline: Console hyperlink selects the whole line instead of just the task name Console hyperlink selects the last line of the task declaration if the task is declared over multiple lines. I think the outliner does a better job - i.e. selects the task name at the beginning of the declaration. With the current information that we get from the Location of the task, not much more we can do. We should revisit and see if there is an improvement in Ant 1.6 (currently the column of the location is not set). As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [Navigator] Rename on Navigator should not collapse tree.
Bug.WithStack:
Build id: 200302211557
Create a project with a few file. Select the project an rename it. The project tree is colapsed. This is probably caused by the fix to viewers to no longer preserve the expansion state on a reused item. Since the name has changed, the underlying handle is not equal to the old one, so the viewer sees them as different. The Rename action could handle this explicitly by getting/setting the expanded state for the element.
Package explorer would have to do the same.
Another possibility is to detect this case in the WorkbenchContentProvider. The delta would have to be setting the MOVED flags properly.
Reassigning to Nick since he is taking ownership of Navigator

Since the name has changed, the underlying handle is not equal to the old one, so the viewer sees them as different. The Rename action could handle this explicitly by getting/setting the expanded state for the element.
Package explorer would have to do the same.
Another possibility is to detect this case in the WorkbenchContentProvider. The delta would have to be setting the MOVED flags properly.

Bug.Summery: Console color for Ant not updated until forced to redraw
Bug.WithStack: Run an Ant build with information output Using the Ant preferences, change the information color. The Console still shows the old color. Scroll the console...the new color shows for the dirtied regions. The console viewer only listens to preference changes for the colors it knows about (those defined in the debug UI). The external tools plug-in would need to listen to these property changes, and then update all console views - (AbstractDebugView#getViwer().refresh()). We may need to override #refresh in the ConsoleViewer to do a repaint, rather than re-setting the entire docuement? Moving to Ant. Needs investigation. Deferred to post 2.1 Reopening for 3.0 Fixed in the AntConsoleColorProvider. Please verify DarinW. Verified

Scroll the console...the new color shows for the dirtied regions. The console viewer only listens to preference changes for the colors it knows about (those defined in the debug UI). The external tools plug-in would need to listen to these property changes, and then update all console views - (AbstractDebugView#getViwer().refresh()). We may need to override #refresh in the ConsoleViewer to do a repaint, rather than re-setting the entire docuement? Moving to Ant. Needs investigation. Bug.Summery: [Navigator] Move project dialog does not keep text content.
Bug.WithStack:
Build id: 200302211557
Select a project in the navigator. Popup menu-> Move. The dialog will open with the option "USe default location" checked and content in the text entry field. Uncheck the box.
The text field content is deleted but it should not. This is done since the default location is not a valid non-default location (eh?)
There are no plans for the UI team to work on this defect until higher priority items are addressed.
This was fixed in the copy/paste dialog but not in the move dialog. See bug 19458. These should actually be the same dialogs because they are so similar. I didn't like the way the field was cleared upon unchecking the checkbox too (especially since that was the only way I could see the full value of the default location when it was truncated (no hover help shows the full value and couldn't resize the dialog larger)) and found the following message confusing when unchecked and then rechecked the "Use default location" check box: Invalid location path. When the project is already in the default (workspace) location you have to enter a non-workspace location. That's why the ok button is disabled when the dialog is first shown with the "use default location" check box checked. See bug 22366. Reassigning to Nick since he is taking ownership of Navigator This is addressed by a patch to bug 224997.
When the move project comes up the default is not checked, and the name is populated with the default location. The text is never cleared regardless of turning on and off the default location. Tod, this has been verified in build I20080502-0100 that the text is properly preserved. You can close this as a dup against bug 224997 since that provided the patch for this.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 224997 ***

Bug.Summery: Standalone: Timeout exception when displayingHelp
Bug.WithStack:
2.1 RC1 build. on AIX. Launching standalone help and displaying help in one step results in help system starting, but browser not openning up. The exception about timout is written to the console. Running command again from another window, opens Help. I have not used the -servertimout option, but may be the default should be longer.
% /usr/java131/bin/java -cp plugins/org.eclipse.help_2.1.0/help.jar org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -command displayHelp -data standalone java.lang.Exception: Timeout waiting for file standalone/.metadata/.connection Eclipse is not running. at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.EclipseConnection.renew (EclipseConnection.java:113) at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.EclipseController.sendHelpCommand (EclipseController.java:87) at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.displayHelp (StandaloneHelp.java:99) at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.executeCommand (StandaloneHelp.java:130) at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.main (StandaloneHelp.java:61) at org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help.main(Help.java:151) This only happened on the first launch, when platform metadata did not exist. After closing and launching again, help opened. Eclipse and its workspace were not on the local har disk, but on the network. That could have impact on speed and locking of files. specifying -servertimout option should be used in such situations. We cannot indefinetely keep increasing the default timeout as it has negative effect on how fast you can restart infocenter (issue start after shutdown) on faster machines.
Bug.WithOutStack:
2.1 RC1 build. on AIX. Launching standalone help and displaying help in one step results in help system starting, but browser not openning up. The exception about timout is written to the console. Running command again from another window, opens Help. I have not used the -servertimout option, but may be the default should be longer.
% /usr/java131/bin/java -cp plugins/org.eclipse.help_2.1.0/help.jar org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -command displayHelp -data standalone java.lang.Exception: Timeout waiting for file standalone/.metadata/.connection Eclipse is not running. at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.EclipseConnection.renew (EclipseConnection.java:113) at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.EclipseController.sendHelpCommand (EclipseController.java:87) at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.displayHelp (StandaloneHelp.java:99) at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.executeCommand (StandaloneHelp.java:130) at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.StandaloneHelp.main (StandaloneHelp.java:61) at org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help.main(Help.java:151) This only happened on the first launch, when platform metadata did not exist. After closing and launching again, help opened. Eclipse and its workspace were not on the local har disk, but on the network. That could have impact on speed and locking of files. specifying -servertimout option should be used in such situations. We cannot indefinetely keep increasing the default timeout as it has negative effect on how fast you can restart infocenter (issue start after shutdown) on faster machines.

Bug.Summery: A2.1: wizard description is overwritten by the error status
Bug.WithStack:
RC1, Windows 2000
The New Plug-in Project page has a description that looks good. As soon as I start entering the project name, the description is replaced by "Plugin name must be specified". I then start typing "c" and the description appears again. As I type "com." (trying to type com.example.xyz), the description is once again replaced by "com. must not end in a period". I think this is disruptiv and the errors should only appear under the description or when the focus is removed from the entry field. This is how all wizards' first pages work. When the page is empty, 'Next' is disabled as you are supposed to enter some project name. As you start typing, we validate the plug-in project name and reject names that are not valid project names.
This pattern is used elsewhere - PDE is not particularly guilty of it. Most of the text entry validators work on each keystroke, not when focus leaves the widget.
Bug.WithOutStack:
RC1, Windows 2000
The New Plug-in Project page has a description that looks good. As soon as I start entering the project name, the description is replaced by "Plugin name must be specified". I then start typing "c" and the description appears again. As I type "com." (trying to type com.example.xyz), the description is once again replaced by "com. must not end in a period". I think this is disruptiv and the errors should only appear under the description or when the focus is removed from the entry field. This is how all wizards' first pages work. When the page is empty, 'Next' is disabled as you are supposed to enter some project name. As you start typing, we validate the plug-in project name and reject names that are not valid project names.
This pattern is used elsewhere - PDE is not particularly guilty of it. Most of the text entry validators work on each keystroke, not when focus leaves the widget.

Bug.Summery: Test scenario has incorrect command for standalone launching
Bug.WithStack:
Scenario for starting stan-alone help list incorrect command.
It says: java -cp plugins/org.eclipse.help_2.1.0/help.jar org.eclipse.help.standalone.Standalone -command displayHelp -data standalone - port 8889 it should be java -cp plugins/org.eclipse.help_2.1.0/help.jar org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -command displayHelp -data standalone
The name of the class is Help, not Standalone, also passing the port is not necessary. Standalone needs to work with dynamic port. Test corrected Monday, Feb 24 at 1:10 Eastern.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Scenario for starting stan-alone help list incorrect command.

Bug.Summery: TVT: Externalized Strings to be removed from .properties file

Lines.Line: 1. open java perspective
2. create a new class
3. add a new field int i to the class
4. right click on the new added field i, select source->generate getter and
setter
5. click ok on generate getter and setter window
6. check the code to see what is generated.
If you conpare the result from zh_TW locale to other locales,
you will notice that for other locales, what is generated is: getI

Bug.WithStack:
Steps: 1. open java perspective 2. create a new class 3. add a new field int i to the class 4. right click on the new added field i, select source->generate getter and setter 5. click ok on generate getter and setter window 6. check the code to see what is generated. If you conpare the result from zh_TW locale to other locales, you will notice that for other locales, what is generated is: getI (); and setI(int i); But in zh_TW locale, the getI() becames "Chinese get CHAR"I(); and the setI(int i) changed into "Chinese set CHAR"I(int i);
Due to fact that some internal labels are translated, the getI and setI are changed into particular characters. This bug was first introduced as PMR43977. The following file has key lines that should not be translated. There should be a comment or something to mark that the following lines are not to be translated.
In the file codegenerationmessages.properties at eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.ui_2.0.2 \jdt_jar\org\eclipse\jdt\internal\corext\codemanipulation
NameProposer.getterPrefix=get NameProposer.queryPrefix=is NameProposer.setterPrefix=set This problem was logged against translation of 2.0.2. However, after analysing the problem, we realized that strings which should not be externalized for translation had been put into file codegenerationmessages.properties of directory eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.ui_2.0.2 \jdt_jar\org\eclipse\jdt\internal\corext\codemanipulation Please ensure that the 3 keywords are being removed from the .properties file for eclipse 2.1 so that the translation centers will not make a mistake of translating them. NameProposer.getterPrefix=get NameProposer.queryPrefix=is NameProposer.setterPrefix=set
If we remove this from the properties file JDT/UI will always suggest setter and getters of the form: setValue, getValue. If the field identifier is not written in English but in German you will get setWert and getWert which is funny as well. The NamePropser class is no longer in use in JDT/UI. Removed keys form JDT/UI land.
Moving to JDT/Core since they are now doing name proposing. David - pls verify that these strings are indeed externalized. Actually, these Strings should NOT be externalized as per original request. Currently these Strings are not externalized.
Closing.

If you conpare the result from zh_TW locale to other locales, you will notice that for other locales, what is generated is: getI (); and setI(int i); But in zh_TW locale, the getI() becames "Chinese get CHAR"I(); and the setI(int i) changed into "Chinese set CHAR"I(int i);

The following file has key lines that should not be translated. There should be a comment or something to mark that the following lines are not to be translated.

NameProposer.getterPrefix=get NameProposer.queryPrefix=is NameProposer.setterPrefix=set This problem was logged against translation of 2.0.2. However, after analysing the problem, we realized that strings which should not be externalized for translation had been put into file codegenerationmessages.properties of directory eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.ui_2.0.2 \jdt_jar\org\eclipse\jdt\internal\corext\codemanipulation Please ensure that the 3 keywords are being removed from the .properties file for eclipse 2.1 so that the translation centers will not make a mistake of translating them. If we remove this from the properties file JDT/UI will always suggest setter and getters of the form: setValue, getValue. Bug.Summery: M5 "locks up" during project refresh

Stacktrace.Reason: Resource is out of sync with the file system: /cosmos/CVS/Entries.

Bug.WithStack:
I'm not sure if this is a GUI threading problem, or if this is a refresh problem... I have a medium sized project (approx 5000 files, including .jar and a few other binaries) that for some reason keeps "locking up" the GUI during a "refresh." I can go into each of the folders within the project and "refresh" with no errors, but if I try to "refresh" the entire project, I have the following symptoms: Progress shows recompilation of the entire project, then during the "in progress..." portion (approx. 60% of the way through), the GUI stops functioning and will not repaint, the CPU goes to 100% utilization, and a ps -ef shows about 10 threads tied to Eclipse. Two of the threads (I am assuming the main thread and a gui thread) each vie for approx 50% cpu utilization. The only way to stop it is to kill the GUI or the main thread associated with Eclipse. Bug.Summery: [Viewers] CheckStateChangedEvent never happens for ICheckStateListener in CheckboxTableViewer

Lines.Line: - your domain model (should not depend on SWT or JFace code)
- a viewer of your choice to show the model
- a content provider that maps between the model and the viewer
- it provides the initial content of the model to the viewer;
- it also tracks changes in the model, and updates the viewer accordingly
- a label provider that provides labels (text and image) for elements in the
model
- optionally a sorter
- optionally one or more filters
- optionally various listeners (selection changed listener, check state
listener, etc)
- use viewer.setInput to tell the viewer about your model
- the viewer then tells the content provider about the input, allowing it to
hook any listeners on the model, and gets the initial list of elements to show
- the viewer passes the elements through the filters and sorter as necessary,
and creates the necessary items
- when the model changes, the content provider is notified via the listener it
hooked, and should update the viewer using add/remove/update/refresh on the
viewer

Bug.WithStack:
I never receive notice of a CheckStateChangedEvent for my CheckboxTableViewer control. The API docs say that there is "no effect if an identical listener is already registered", but I did not register another listener, so if there is one, how did it get registered? Or more specifically, how can I find out when a checkbox inside a CheckboxTableViewer has been selected?
Thanks, Sean Created attachment 3679 Source Example
This is a test case inside of a Launch Configuration tab. The necessary XML for plugin.xml is commented out at the top of the source code. In your example, you are directly creating SWT items in the widget used by the viewer. This is crossing levels of abstraction. When using JFace viewers, you should not generally manipulate the SWT control directly, except for layout.
Viewers are model-based adapters to SWT widgets.
You need: - your domain model (should not depend on SWT or JFace code) - a viewer of your choice to show the model - a content provider that maps between the model and the viewer - it provides the initial content of the model to the viewer; - it also tracks changes in the model, and updates the viewer accordingly - a label provider that provides labels (text and image) for elements in the model - optionally a sorter - optionally one or more filters - optionally various listeners (selection changed listener, check state listener, etc)
Once the viewer is all set up, - use viewer.setInput to tell the viewer about your model - the viewer then tells the content provider about the input, allowing it to hook any listeners on the model, and gets the initial list of elements to show - the viewer passes the elements through the filters and sorter as necessary, and creates the necessary items - when the model changes, the content provider is notified via the listener it hooked, and should update the viewer using add/remove/update/refresh on the viewer
Created attachment 3896 Fixed up TestLaunchApplicationTabGroup.java
This configures a content provider, label provider, sorter, and sets the input to be a model. In this case, the model is an unchanging array of model elements. The model elements are two-element arrays mimicking a property object. The content provider is an ArrayContentProvider, which handles the common case where the model is a static array. The label provider just takes the strings out of the array. The sorter sorts based on the first item in the array (the property name). Not a bug in the viewers. With the attached changes, the check state listener is now called.
FYI, the reason it wasn't working is that, internally, viewers use setData() on the SWT items to remember the corresponding model element. Since you created the SWT items yourself, they did not have the model element set. CheckBoxTreeViewer.handleSelect does a null check and does not fire the event if getData() returns null.
Note that viewer listeners like selection listeners and check state listeners are always in terms of model elements, not SWT widgets, preserving the abstraction.
Wow, I did not know all of this. Thanks so much for your help.
-Sean

I never receive notice of a CheckStateChangedEvent for my CheckboxTableViewer control. The API docs say that there is "no effect if an identical listener is already registered", but I did not register another listener, so if there is one, how did it get registered? Or more specifically, how can I find out when a checkbox inside a CheckboxTableViewer has been selected?

You need: - your domain model (should not depend on SWT or JFace code) - a viewer of your choice to show the model - a content provider that maps between the model and the viewer - it provides the initial content of the model to the viewer; - it also tracks changes in the model, and updates the viewer accordingly - a label provider that provides labels (text and image) for elements in the model - optionally a sorter - optionally one or more filters - optionally various listeners (selection changed listener, check state listener, etc)

Created attachment 3896 Fixed up TestLaunchApplicationTabGroup.java

The model elements are two-element arrays mimicking a property object. The content provider is an ArrayContentProvider, which handles the common case where the model is a static array. Bug.Summery: Standalone: calling stand alone to display help does not return
Bug.WithStack:
2.1 RC1. Run command from help scenario SA, multiple times (from 3 consoles). 1 would start standalone (display help or not due to timeout) 2 would display help 3 would display help
Run command to shutdown standalone. The program in console 1 would exit and return to prompt. Commands in console 2 and 3 keep running.
Looking at processes it shows me 2 eclipses and 4 javas running. This is very bad. It looks like the lock mechanism did not work. Command in consoles 2 and 3, launched Eclipse before displaying Help. There is no nice work around to shut down these instances of eclipse. Since they all share the metadata, the .connection file is overwritten and there is no way to find out port used by instances launched earlier. If port is passed when launching, only the first one will be closed, and the others are not since they cannot listen on the already used port. Eclipse and its workspace were not on the local har disk, but on the network. That could have impact on speed and locking of files. Same behavior on Solaris (second call to display help does not exit). When testingon Solaris, Eclipse was running of a local drive. The problem was .lock file that only works on Windows. See bug 25342 agains core.
Since on non Windows platform the file can be deleted, our code was launching new help system (that is supposed not to return to command line), instead of just asking the already running instance to display help.
I released a fix for non windows platforms to try to establish HTTP connection to the already running eclipse, instead of trying deletion of a .lock file. In Eclipse 2.2, this code should be replaced with creating real file lock using Java 1.4 APIs.
Bug.WithOutStack:
2.1 RC1. Run command from help scenario SA, multiple times (from 3 consoles). 1 would start standalone (display help or not due to timeout) 2 would display help 3 would display help
Run command to shutdown standalone. The program in console 1 would exit and return to prompt. Commands in console 2 and 3 keep running.
Looking at processes it shows me 2 eclipses and 4 javas running. This is very bad. It looks like the lock mechanism did not work. Command in consoles 2 and 3, launched Eclipse before displaying Help. There is no nice work around to shut down these instances of eclipse. Since they all share the metadata, the .connection file is overwritten and there is no way to find out port used by instances launched earlier. If port is passed when launching, only the first one will be closed, and the others are not since they cannot listen on the already used port. Eclipse and its workspace were not on the local har disk, but on the network. That could have impact on speed and locking of files. Same behavior on Solaris (second call to display help does not exit). When testingon Solaris, Eclipse was running of a local drive. The problem was .lock file that only works on Windows. See bug 25342 agains core.
Since on non Windows platform the file can be deleted, our code was launching new help system (that is supposed not to return to command line), instead of just asking the already running instance to display help.
I released a fix for non windows platforms to try to establish HTTP connection to the already running eclipse, instead of trying deletion of a .lock file. In Eclipse 2.2, this code should be replaced with creating real file lock using Java 1.4 APIs.

Bug.Summery: [breakpoints] Entry/exit breakpoint with hitcount
Bug.WithStack:
* Place a method breakpoint on a method that is entered many times * Configure to suspend on both method entry & exit * Add a hit count to the breakponit (say 3)
-> The breakpoint suspends on the third entry and third exit, and every third entry/exit after that. Normally a hit count only suspends the breakpoint once. To be consistent, the breakpoint should only stop on the 3rh entry & exit. Nothing planned for 2.1 - not a common use case. Consider for 3.0 The internal model appears to be hosed badly. Jared helped explain this to me, but it looks like the MethodBreakpoint uses some trickery to implement the hit count. Either a LineBreakpoint or a MethodEntryBreakpoint is used, depeneding on wether it is possible to optimize (Use a LineBreakpoint if there is a line) for the entry. The problem is that when setting both entry and exit breakpoints with a hit count, the code does not handle disabling the second request after the first request has satisfied the hit count. As a result, the break point is re-enabled every time it's hit.
A work-around patch is to check to see if the breakpoint has expired when we handle the event, but this doesn't really fix the underlying model. I'll send the patch to Jared and he can decide if we should apply the patch in the mean time, of if we need to wait until the model is fixed. This is over my head for a "working-at-home" day, as Jared warned :-) Created attachment 6976 Proposed work-around patch The other thing that Jared and I discussed was wether it was a bug that the UI didn't show the breakpoint as enabled after the hit count was reached and the method entry point was hit. Now, I am not sure if this wrong, since the breakpoint should get disabled after the hit count is reached and the breakpoint hit. This is what happens with the work-around patch that I've attached to this report. Deferred *** Bug 98216 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** reopening marking as won't fix
Bug.WithOutStack:
* Place a method breakpoint on a method that is entered many times * Configure to suspend on both method entry & exit * Add a hit count to the breakponit (say 3)
-> The breakpoint suspends on the third entry and third exit, and every third entry/exit after that. Normally a hit count only suspends the breakpoint once. To be consistent, the breakpoint should only stop on the 3rh entry & exit. Nothing planned for 2.1 - not a common use case. Consider for 3.0 The internal model appears to be hosed badly. Jared helped explain this to me, but it looks like the MethodBreakpoint uses some trickery to implement the hit count. Either a LineBreakpoint or a MethodEntryBreakpoint is used, depeneding on wether it is possible to optimize (Use a LineBreakpoint if there is a line) for the entry. The problem is that when setting both entry and exit breakpoints with a hit count, the code does not handle disabling the second request after the first request has satisfied the hit count. As a result, the break point is re-enabled every time it's hit.
A work-around patch is to check to see if the breakpoint has expired when we handle the event, but this doesn't really fix the underlying model. I'll send the patch to Jared and he can decide if we should apply the patch in the mean time, of if we need to wait until the model is fixed. This is over my head for a "working-at-home" day, as Jared warned :-) Created attachment 6976 Proposed work-around patch The other thing that Jared and I discussed was wether it was a bug that the UI didn't show the breakpoint as enabled after the hit count was reached and the method entry point was hit. Now, I am not sure if this wrong, since the breakpoint should get disabled after the hit count is reached and the breakpoint hit. This is what happens with the work-around patch that I've attached to this report. Deferred *** Bug 98216 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** reopening marking as won't fix

Bug.Summery: [breakpoints] mod/access watchpoint with hit count
Bug.WithStack:
* Create a watch point configured for both access/modification * add a hit count of 1 * the breakpoint stops on the first mod (in my case) * the breakpoint renders as disabled * the breakpoint stops on the first access * no more stops
Since the breakpoint is still configured to suspend on a the access after the first modification, it should not render as disabled until after the first access (in my case).
Like entry/exit breakpoints, hit counts are not intuitive with these breakpoints. It is not clear what the expected behavior is - i.e. is the hit count per access (entry) and per mod (exit), or both?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 28052 *** Typed in wrong field.... re-opening Nothing planned for 2.1 - not a common use case. Consider for 3.0 Looking at this I'm not sure what a hit count means in the case of a mod/access watchpoint. Do we suspend on the total of (mod + access = hit count) or when (mod = hit count) or (access = hitcount). My feeling is the later - i.e. on the 3rd access and 3rd modification. Opinions? We create 2 event requests, so the VM sends an event after the Nth access and an event after the Nth modification. deferred reopening Marking as won't fix

Bug.Summery: [About] Fails to launch web browser
Bug.WithStack:
Eclipse 20030221
If you select a link on the about dialog the web browser will fail to open. Probably related to bug 29356 The code in ProductInfoDialog#openWebBrowser, which is a hack for linux, does not consider the Mac case. As per the comments the ultimate solution is to move the help framework down and then remove that method. In the meantime I was going to modify the code to check the swtplatform, and then make the appropriate guesses (from the help framework) to find the 'correct' web browser. A good way to open an URL in an already running (or to launch a new) web browser is by executing "/usr/bin/open http://www.eclipse.org" It uses the user's default browser (configured in the MacOS X Internet pref panel). /usr/bin/open fails if the file to be displayed is not a URL, for example an html file, which is invoked if the 'more info' button is pressed. The two strings passed to open were as follows when I first followed a link, and then pressed the 'more info' button.
http://www.apache.org file:D/ide/eclipse/features/org.eclipse.sdk.win32_2.1.0/license.html Need to change format of the file command to: file:///D/ide/eclipse/features/org.eclipse.sdk.win32_2.1.0/license.html Fixed in N20030227 Closing

Bug.Summery: Commiting with an unedited template
Bug.WithStack: If the server is configured to provide a commit template, this template is displayed in the commit dialog of Eclipse. If the user doesn't edit the template, it is sent as the comment. In this case, the user should be prompted to edit the template or an empty comment should be sent (or some combination of this: i.e. user warned that continuing will result in an empty comment). Fix released to HEAD. Comment is not sent if it matches the template. No prompting was added since we don't prompt if the comment is left blank either.
Bug.WithOutStack: If the server is configured to provide a commit template, this template is displayed in the commit dialog of Eclipse. If the user doesn't edit the template, it is sent as the comment. In this case, the user should be prompted to edit the template or an empty comment should be sent (or some combination of this: i.e. user warned that continuing will result in an empty comment). Fix released to HEAD. Comment is not sent if it matches the template. No prompting was added since we don't prompt if the comment is left blank either.

Dejan, When Platform UI took over the schemas, the "class" attribute for <action> in the actionSets extension was made optional. So when the user creates an <action> in the gui pages, PDE no longer assigns a default class name to the "class" attribute, as it is now optional. Therefore, when you launch the new attribute class wizard, the package field is not primed with anything, and no class name is shown. Please modify the test case to reflect the new behavior. True - class is now optional. I changed the script to stop implying that some values will be preset.

Bug.Summery: Incorrect error message on failure to save .project

Lines.Line: 1) Create a simple project
2) Edit the .project file.
3) Delete a character, for example, change "<buildSpec>" to "<uildSpec>"
-> Error message saying file is out of sync with the file system, with prompt to
overwrite, Yes/No.
4) Click Yes.
-> Another out of sync error message with prompt to overwrite.
5) Click Yes.

Bug.WithStack:
Build: 2.1 RC1
1) Create a simple project 2) Edit the .project file. 3) Delete a character, for example, change "<buildSpec>" to "<uildSpec>"
-> Error message saying file is out of sync with the file system, with prompt to overwrite, Yes/No.
4) Click Yes.
-> Another out of sync error message with prompt to overwrite.
5) Click Yes.
-> Finally you get the correct error message, that the .project file is now invalid.
What is happening: whenever there is a CoreException on save, the editor framework checks the file timestamp, and compares it to a cached timestamp. If the times are different, it reports the failure as an out of sync error. In this case, we've successfully written the file, but want to warn the user that the file is now in an invalid state. The fact that the time stamp has been updated does not mean the file is now out of sync. The text framework should use IResource.isSynchronized rather than caching and checking the timestamp itself. The raised issue is valid. However, investigation shows that we cannot change the document providers as they are API since 1.0 and thus the conceptual model they implement.
There seems also to be a related core issue: Throwing this kind of exception during IFile.setContents implies that the operation failed. I interpret this as that the content of the file has not been changed. However, what happens is that the operation was successful but that the new content violates the consistence rules. The exception should be thrown before the contents is changed and not after the fact.
Moving to Platfrom Core. Closing. Text team cannot fix, and we don't plan changing behaviour of setContents. Bug 33876 shows another scenario where the same behaviour happens.

Build: 2.1 RC1
1) Create a simple project 2) Edit the .project file. 3) Delete a character, for example, change "<buildSpec>" to "<uildSpec>"

4) Click Yes.
-> Another out of sync error message with prompt to overwrite.
5) Click Yes.
-> Finally you get the correct error message, that the .project file is now invalid.
What is happening: whenever there is a CoreException on save, the editor framework checks the file timestamp, and compares it to a cached timestamp. If the times are different, it reports the failure as an out of sync error. In this case, we've successfully written the file, but want to warn the user that the file is now in an invalid state. The fact that the time stamp has been updated does not mean the file is now out of sync. The text framework should use IResource.isSynchronized rather than caching and checking the timestamp itself. The raised issue is valid. However, investigation shows that we cannot change the document providers as they are API since 1.0 and thus the conceptual model they implement.
There seems also to be a related core issue: Throwing this kind of exception during IFile.setContents implies that the operation failed. I interpret this as that the content of the file has not been changed. However, what happens is that the operation was successful but that the new content violates the consistence rules. The exception should be thrown before the contents is changed and not after the fact.
Moving to Platfrom Core. Closing. Text team cannot fix, and we don't plan changing behaviour of setContents. Bug 33876 shows another scenario where the same behaviour happens.

Bug.Summery: Java application launch shortcut error doesn't help user

Lines.Line: 1. Open a java file containing a main method.
2. Select a non-resource-based view (such as the Debug view).
3. Click Debug As->Java Application.
4. A dialog appears: "Launch failed: no main type found".

Bug.WithStack:
1. Open a java file containing a main method. 2. Select a non-resource-based view (such as the Debug view). 3. Click Debug As->Java Application. 4. A dialog appears: "Launch failed: no main type found".
We should consider tracking resource selection the way external tools tracks selection for variable expansion (in fact, we should be able to combine the two into a single mechanism?). Also, we should improve the quality of the error message. The message should give the user a hint about what they need to do to fix the problem - in this case, they need to select a resource. The message should say something like "Launch failed: No file with a main type selected" Propose to improve error message, but not to change selection handling for 2.1 Improved error message - it's one of
"The active editor does not contain a main type"
or
"The selection does not contain a main type" Please verify, Jared. NOTE: the selection handling has been improved in the debug platform - when there is no active editor, or no selection, launch shortcuts are not enabled. However, since the launch shortcuts are extension points, the action itself cannot do any enabling based on the selection (and if we added it, it would break the lazy-load rules). Verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
1. Open a java file containing a main method. 2. Select a non-resource-based view (such as the Debug view). 3. Click Debug As->Java Application. 4. A dialog appears: "Launch failed: no main type found".
We should consider tracking resource selection the way external tools tracks selection for variable expansion (in fact, we should be able to combine the two into a single mechanism?). Also, we should improve the quality of the error message. The message should give the user a hint about what they need to do to fix the problem - in this case, they need to select a resource. The message should say something like "Launch failed: No file with a main type selected" Propose to improve error message, but not to change selection handling for 2.1 Improved error message - it's one of
"The active editor does not contain a main type"
or
"The selection does not contain a main type" Please verify, Jared. NOTE: the selection handling has been improved in the debug platform - when there is no active editor, or no selection, launch shortcuts are not enabled. However, since the launch shortcuts are extension points, the action itself cannot do any enabling based on the selection (and if we added it, it would break the lazy-load rules). Verified.

Bug.Summery: [Perspectives] Shortcut bar hover text combines two parts causing problems in some languages.
Bug.WithStack:
If you hover over any icon in the shortcut bar, it appears that the text displayed is a concatenation of two words, which causes a problem in some languages. Specifically, there are two cases:
In Brazilian Portuguese, "xxx Perspectiva" is displayed instead of "Perspectiva xxx", which does not make sense in Brazilian Portuguese. There is no way to enter the correct text.
In Simplified Chinese, there is a space between the title and the word "Perspective" which does not make sense in Simplified Chinese. There is no way to get rid of the extra space. Created attachment 3681 Screenshot of the problem in Brazilian Portuguese Created attachment 3682 Screenshot of the problem in Simplified Chinese. Should use a message format instead of concatenation. We already do use a message format here. This looks like a translation error.
The key is SetPagePerspectiveAction.toolTip in the messages.properties file in package org.eclipse.ui.internal in project org.eclipse.ui.workbench.
Cleanup - resolving as WORKSFORME. Previous comment showed that this was an error in the tooltip text.

Bug.Summery: Description in Ant preference page is confusing.
Bug.WithStack:
Build id: 200302211557
Preferences->Ant The sentence: "Enter the names of the build files to find if using Run As->Ant Build and the selected resource is not Ant build file."
It seems that there is something missing in this sentence. The sentence is accurate but I agree that it is hard to decipher.
If the user select a resource that is not an XML file and chooses Run As->Ant Build, we will search through the file hierarchy (upwards, I believe) searching for a build file. This preference allows the user to specify what file names to look for during this search.
This feature was implemented upon user request. It emulates the behavior of "ant -find" from the command line.
Suggestions for improving the description are welcome. :) Here are two options:
Enter the names of the build files to find when using Run As > Ant Build if the selection is not Ant build file.
Enter the names of the build files to find if the selection is not an Ant build file when using Run As > Ant Build.
Question: Can't we get all *.xml file and file out which ones are Ant Build files? So we could delete this preference?
>>Can't we get all *.xml file and file out which ones are Ant Build >>files? So we could delete this preference? This was too expensive during the current stream (we only received fast xml parsing late in the game). The preference would still be needed to emulate the -find of command line ant. You can specify the name of the build file to find.
Thanks for the suggestions.
Reworked the description...used Eduardo's suggestions tied in with the description of -find from Apache Ant.
Please verify DarinW. I found the first line confusing, and adjusted it. I suggest we put the information about search ordering (i.e. from the selection, up towards the root), into the help file. (But I don't think we have a help file for Ant/Ext Tools yet). See adjustments Please verify, Darin (S). One more slight modification. Verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Build id: 200302211557
Preferences->Ant The sentence: "Enter the names of the build files to find if using Run As->Ant Build and the selected resource is not Ant build file."
It seems that there is something missing in this sentence. The sentence is accurate but I agree that it is hard to decipher.
If the user select a resource that is not an XML file and chooses Run As->Ant Build, we will search through the file hierarchy (upwards, I believe) searching for a build file. This preference allows the user to specify what file names to look for during this search.
This feature was implemented upon user request. It emulates the behavior of "ant -find" from the command line.
Suggestions for improving the description are welcome. :) Here are two options:
Enter the names of the build files to find when using Run As > Ant Build if the selection is not Ant build file.
Enter the names of the build files to find if the selection is not an Ant build file when using Run As > Ant Build.
Question: Can't we get all *.xml file and file out which ones are Ant Build files? So we could delete this preference?
>>Can't we get all *.xml file and file out which ones are Ant Build >>files? So we could delete this preference? This was too expensive during the current stream (we only received fast xml parsing late in the game). The preference would still be needed to emulate the -find of command line ant. You can specify the name of the build file to find.
Thanks for the suggestions.
Reworked the description...used Eduardo's suggestions tied in with the description of -find from Apache Ant.
Please verify DarinW. I found the first line confusing, and adjusted it. I suggest we put the information about search ordering (i.e. from the selection, up towards the root), into the help file. (But I don't think we have a help file for Ant/Ext Tools yet). See adjustments Please verify, Darin (S). One more slight modification. Verified.

Bug.Summery: Run external programs does not recognize Mac programs
Bug.WithStack:
Try to set up an external tools config on OSX and choose some simple app like the 'Clock'. The dialog seems like it does not recognize the .app extension. Yes, an application bundle (xxx.app) isn't executable in the normal Unix sense. It can only be launched via "/usr/bin/open" or by launching the "real" executable within the bundle.

Bug.Summery: Project description name data cannot span multiple lines
Bug.WithStack:
If a project description file has the following: <name> abc </name>
the carriage returns, tabs, extra spaces, etc. will all be part of the name. We need to trim extra whitespace off the string before setting it in the project description.
Check all other fields which use character data too. See ProjectDescriptionReader.endElement(). Should also consider which other fields should be trimmed when being read from the file. (referenced projects, builders, natures, etc) In ProjectDescriptorReader, all data read via the 'characters' method will be prone to this problem. Since characters() only appends character data to a StringBuffer called charBuffer, all uses of charBuffer must be examined. Created attachment 3794 patch file
Have attached a patch from Debbie. Project names must not begin or end with a whitespace (this is enforced by workspace.validateName) but what about other values in the project description? I believe that most other values are allowed to have trailing whitespace...is this true? Created attachment 3820 proposed solution Created attachment 3821 proposed changes to test suite 'Proposed solution' and 'proposed changes to test suite' from attachments reviewed and released.

(referenced projects, builders, natures, etc) In ProjectDescriptorReader, all data read via the 'characters' method will be prone to this problem. Bug.Summery: renaming linked folder leads to bugs

Lines.Line: 1) Create a simple project 'xxx'
2) Create a linked folder 'junit' to an existing empty location
3) Add a file below the linked folder
4) Rename the linked folder
5) Copy the linked folder
- Created a project xxx, with a linked folder junit
- In the navigator select 'junit' and renamed it to 'junit1'
- Select 'junit1' and try to copy. Choose 'Copy of junit' as name.
A error dialog shows up. Element not found: /xxx/junit.
From now on all other opeartions with linked folders brought this error dialog.
- the linked folder contains files
- the project was a java project
- rename was chosen from the context menu (inplace edit in navigator tree)
- copy/paste on the file using CTRL+C /CTRL+P, confirmed the suggested new name
without changes
Excellent, thanks Martin. I've been trying to track this down for awhile. The
important feature in the steps was that the folder contained files. It didn't
matter if it was a java project. So, exact steps are:

Bug.WithStack:
RC1
- Created a project xxx, with a linked folder junit - In the navigator select 'junit' and renamed it to 'junit1' - Select 'junit1' and try to copy. Choose 'Copy of junit' as name. A error dialog shows up. Element not found: /xxx/junit. From now on all other opeartions with linked folders brought this error dialog.
log:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Feb 24, 2003 21:00:57.935 !MESSAGE Exception in org.eclipse.ui.actions.CopyFilesAndFoldersOperation.performCopy(): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Element not found: /xxx/junit. !ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Feb 24, 2003 21:02:29.306 !MESSAGE Exception in org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardNewFolderMainPage.getNewFolder(): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Element not found: /xxx/junit. !ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Feb 24, 2003 21:03:18.527 !MESSAGE Exception in org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardNewFolderMainPage.getNewFolder(): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Element not found: /xxx/junit. Can you reproduce this from an empty workspace? I have seen this problem before but was never able to create a reproducible case. Following your exact steps in a new workspace did not reproduce the problem for me. Yes, just tried and I could reproduce it with a new and empty workspace Some more details, don't know if it matters
- the linked folder contains files - the project was a java project - rename was chosen from the context menu (inplace edit in navigator tree) - copy/paste on the file using CTRL+C /CTRL+P, confirmed the suggested new name without changes Excellent, thanks Martin. I've been trying to track this down for awhile. The important feature in the steps was that the folder contained files. It didn't matter if it was a java project. So, exact steps are:
1) Create a simple project 'xxx' 2) Create a linked folder 'junit' to an existing empty location 3) Add a file below the linked folder 4) Rename the linked folder 5) Copy the linked folder
-> Error.
The lifecycle event for PRE_LINK_MOVE was not being fired. This resulted in the AliasManager's location table having a stale location for the old link. Since this stale location overlapped the location of the moved resource, it caused a failure during refresh of aliases when the moved link was modified.
Fixed by adding the lifecycle event in Resource.move. Regression test added to BasicAliasTest.

- the linked folder contains files - the project was a java project - rename was chosen from the context menu (inplace edit in navigator tree) - copy/paste on the file using CTRL+C /CTRL+P, confirmed the suggested new name without changes Excellent, thanks Martin. I've been trying to track this down for awhile. The important feature in the steps was that the folder contained files. It didn't matter if it was a java project. So, exact steps are:
1) Create a simple project 'xxx' 2) Create a linked folder 'junit' to an existing empty location 3) Add a file below the linked folder 4) Rename the linked folder 5) Copy the linked folder
-> Error.
The lifecycle event for PRE_LINK_MOVE was not being fired. This resulted in the AliasManager's location table having a stale location for the old link. Since this stale location overlapped the location of the moved resource, it caused a failure during refresh of aliases when the moved link was modified.
Fixed by adding the lifecycle event in Resource.move. Regression test added to BasicAliasTest.

Bug.Summery: A8.4: Cannot change labelAttribute
Bug.WithStack:
RC1, windows 2000
I cannot change the labelAttribute to 'name'. After I enter name and switch to another properties cell the name gets cleared. Same onn AIX. Additionally, after typing "name", the status bar displays: "name" is not a valid attribute name. Actually, I noticed that if all the attributes are entered (including the name attributes) it is then possible to change labelAttribute. Yes. This is the script error - you are now not allowed to set the label attribute to an invalid attribute name. So you must define attributes first, then pick one to be used for visual representation of the element (for label provider).
Fixed the script.

Additionally, after typing "name", the status bar displays: "name" is not a valid attribute name. Actually, I noticed that if all the attributes are entered (including the name attributes) it is then possible to change labelAttribute. Yes. This is the script error - you are now not allowed to set the label attribute to an invalid attribute name. So you must define attributes first, then pick one to be used for visual representation of the element (for label provider).
Fixed the script.

Bug.Summery: [EditorMgmt] Allow control of editor tab compression
Bug.WithStack:
Please bring it back. The current width of the tab is to small to guess the name of the class. I myself normally set it to medium prior to it being removed on RC1. Bug #31564 removed this functionality from the preference pages, the underlying code is still there.
Users can access EditorList and TabCompression via the file plugin_customization.ini in <eclipse_install_directory>/plugins/org.eclipse.platform_2.1.0
For example add the following two lines to have the pulldown active, and the tabs not compress: org.eclipse.ui.workbench/EDITORLIST_PULLDOWN_ACTIVE=true org.eclipse.ui.workbench/EDITOR_TAB_WIDTH=20
Values for compression were: high=3, medium=6, low=9, none=30
The EditorList view can also be restored by editting the plugin.xml of org.eclipse.ui, uncomment the EditorView entry.
There are no plans for the UI team to work on this defect until higher priority items are addressed. The workaround described here by Andrew Irvine appears to have been disabled in M6. Is there an update to this workaround? This was not intentionally removed in M6, we will investigate what happened. Created attachment 13297 Image Showing Previous Behaviour
This image shows Eclipse 2.1.3, with Andrew's plug-in customization lines. This seems very similar to our current mechanism, but without the ability to affect the amount of compression. Created attachment 13298 Image Showing Current Behaviour
Again, with Andrew's plug-in customization lines, but notice that it has no effect. We still compress the tab text up to some hard-coded internal limit, at which point we display the drop-down.
I'm assuming that, at this point, it would be sufficient to provide some way of controlling that compression value. *** Bug 56787 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Bug 56787 has a patch to change this behaviour. Patch committed to CVS, and should appear in I200409200800 and later.
Now, you can control this behaviour with a customization line such as the following: EDITOR_MINIMUM_CHARACTERS=80
The value is the minimum number of characters to display in the tab of the editor. Setting this value to some arbitrarily large value (e.g., 10000), will ensure no compression. Setting this value to -1 is the same as not setting it at all. The normal default value is 10. Is this an API preference (in org.eclipse.ui's pref store and defined in IWorkbenchPreferenceConstants), or an internal one? This preference is defined in IWorkbenchPreferenceConstants, and initialized in UIPreferenceInitializer. This does not work in I200409212000. The problem is a bogus line for comparing the default and the actual preference value. It's silly, and I don't know what possessed me to put it there.
I have a patch.... Created attachment 14707 Patch to "org.eclipse.ui.workbench"
Removes lines related to comparing the default and actual value, as plugin_customization.ini sets the default value. Patch reviewed by Kim and Billy, and applied to CVS. This should appear in I200409230010 and later. Verified in I200409230010, GTK+ 2.4.9, KDE 3.3.0, Linux 2.6.8.1. Oh, and there is a mistake in comment #9. The line should read:
org.eclipse.ui/EDITOR_MINIMUM_CHARACTERS=80 Filed bug 119890 for the view tab compression case.

Bug.Summery: Changing compiler prefs prompts for rebuild for no reason

Lines.Line: 1) Go to the preference page Plugin Development > Compiler > Plugins
2) Toggle one of the warnings to "Ignore", then toggle back to "Warning".
3) Click "Apply"
-> It prompts for a full rebuild, even though nothing has changed.
4) Click "Yes" in this prompt dialog. Wait for full build to complete
5) Click "Ok" in the preference page.

Bug.WithStack:
Build: 2.1 RC1
1) Go to the preference page Plugin Development > Compiler > Plugins 2) Toggle one of the warnings to "Ignore", then toggle back to "Warning". 3) Click "Apply"
-> It prompts for a full rebuild, even though nothing has changed.
4) Click "Yes" in this prompt dialog. Wait for full build to complete
5) Click "Ok" in the preference page.
-> It prompts that another full rebuild is required. It just finished building! Fixed. A more severe problem was the fact that a full workspace build was invoked after changing the PDE builder preferences.
This has also been fixed now. Depending on which builder(s) is/are affected by the changes (plugin, feature or schema), we now call project.build(int,String,Map,IProgressMonitor) on plug- in/feature projects as appropriate.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Build: 2.1 RC1
1) Go to the preference page Plugin Development > Compiler > Plugins 2) Toggle one of the warnings to "Ignore", then toggle back to "Warning". 3) Click "Apply"
-> It prompts for a full rebuild, even though nothing has changed.
4) Click "Yes" in this prompt dialog. Wait for full build to complete
5) Click "Ok" in the preference page.
-> It prompts that another full rebuild is required. It just finished building! Fixed. A more severe problem was the fact that a full workspace build was invoked after changing the PDE builder preferences.
This has also been fixed now. Depending on which builder(s) is/are affected by the changes (plugin, feature or schema), we now call project.build(int,String,Map,IProgressMonitor) on plug- in/feature projects as appropriate.

Bug.Summery: Search for "$nl$" yields that same results as search for "nl"
Bug.WithStack:
Build: RC1 Search for "$nl$" results in 11 documents. All of these documents, except for the second one, show false positives, as they match "nl" instead of "$nl$". This includes the document which returned with a 100% accuracy. Search for "nl" yields the exact same results as "$nl$", which leads me to believe that $ is being treated as punctuation. This happens for both quoted and uquoted search queries (stemmed and exact search). English analyzer only returns letters, and exact analyzers ignores everything that is not letter or digit. Removing punctuation should be done as a preference settings, as in most cases users are not concerned with punctuation or special characters. Marking this as enhancement. In plenty of programming languages, @, #, and $ are identifiers - not punctuation. The user should be able to search for parameter names, system macros, etc. that include these.
Users should also be able to search 'punctuation' that appears as part of filenames/paths: '.', ':', '/', etc. For example, in Eclipse, I might want to look for help about the workspace metadata .log file - but searching for this just gives me help pages that contain the word 'log', 'dialog', etc. (yes, I do realize that you can include just about any character in a filename/path - especially on Unix).
Similarly, you'll find 'punctuation' in command line parameters/runtime options. In the Eclipse help, searching for '-data' nets me a bunch of hits containing the word 'data' - but the page I would likely have preferred (Eclipse runtime options - the one that actually contains the string, -data) is low in the list of search hits.
I could go on... but I hope I've made my point. There are many legitimate reasons for needing to include these characters in a search term. Search should consider any non-null character valid. This should not be considered an enhancement request - this should be considered a high-priority bug. I'm just wondering if anything can be done to reconsider the status of this bug. I've already explained why I believe it should not be considered P3 or an enhancement - but it concerns me that this still shows a target of 2.1. In *many* cases, what you are referring to as 'punctuation' are not punctuation at all - they are identifiers, parameters, options, etc. that should be considered valid search elements. Jennifer, The target is not 2.1, it is not set to anything. 2.1 is the Eclipse version in which the problem is initially discovered. Considering other Help and Eclipse bugs at P3 priority, I believe this functionality is at most P3. The bus is perfectly valid.
This behavior appears when using out of a box Eclipse. Your product can override this by contributing a different text analyzer that will preserve characters you need when tokenizing text. See org.eclipse.help.base.luceneAnalyzer extension point. Marking as P4 - unlikely to be looked at for 3.1.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 107644 ***

Bug.Summery: Cannot undo code assist insertion in Ant Editor
Bug.WithStack:
Create a new Ant build file. Ctrl-Space to insert <project ></project> Hit Ctrl-Z. The inserted proposal is not removed. Undo works in the general case. Deferred to post 2.1 *** Bug 34153 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** I don't see the rationale for deferring this bug? Obviously undo does not work "in the general case". I'm pretty sure such a bug would not be deferred in the Java editor. Reopening. Kai, can you take a quick look at this? This works for me in the latest code. Is it possible that Christof submitted a fix for this since Feb 24? The problem I consistently see is that the cursor jumps to the start of the editor. The inserted proposal is removed. Christof, care to comment? :) I am pretty sure that Christof has left the building... This is a problem of the redraw==false state in the TextViewer. As you have tagged it RC3, I assume two component leads have approved it. So, I'll borrow :) one of the voices and will release the fix for RC3.
Moving to Platform Text. Build 20030314. Reviewed by Dani. Thanks Kai. verified on 20030318

Bug.Summery: Bookmarks tab does not allow en masse deletion of bookmarks

Lines.Line: 1. create a few bookmarks.
2. go to the bookmarks tab.
3. Multiple selection is not allowed, as selecting an item takes to that page.
So if someone wants to remove all bookmarks, he has to right-click on every
item in the list and choose 'remove'.
Maybe you should consider adding a 'remove all' menu item.
Yes, this is a good suggestion. Marking this as an enhacement.
Added "Delete All" to the menu.

Bug.Summery: Jar Packager strips Class-Path from Manifest
Bug.WithStack:
I am creating a jar using an existing manifest file that has Class-Path: setting.
The jar file created by the Jar Packager is missing Class-Path in the manifest file. Daniel, please comment. This is probably caused by an invalid manifest files. The manifest in the JAR is generated by the manifest writer from the used SDK i.e. it reads your file, validates it and uses all entries which are valid. If the input file does not follow the JAR manifest spec (e.g. missing newlines) then the corresponding entries are removed.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I am creating a jar using an existing manifest file that has Class-Path: setting.
The jar file created by the Jar Packager is missing Class-Path in the manifest file. Daniel, please comment. This is probably caused by an invalid manifest files. The manifest in the JAR is generated by the manifest writer from the used SDK i.e. it reads your file, validates it and uses all entries which are valid. If the input file does not follow the JAR manifest spec (e.g. missing newlines) then the corresponding entries are removed.
